commitResults.messageBody:

- If "list" command is issued, print list of stored items
- Otherwise, add input string to stored item list

- Mark and unmark tasks as done or not done
- Allow switching tasks between done/not done

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement saving task data to hard disk
commitResults.messageBody:
Level-7
- Rename DukeList to TaskList for consistency
- Use file I/O operations to save task data to hard disk
- Create data/duke.txt if it doesn't exist on the user's device
- Implement a Storage class to encapsulate the above

Level-8
- Create DukeDateTimeFormatter class with a static method to encapsulate formatting in one place
- Implement DukeDateTimeFormatter in Deadline and Event classes
- Create formattedAt/formattedBy strings to represent formatted date-time strings, replace into toString

commitResults.messageTitle: Add exception handling for incorrect date/time formats
Create abstractions to further implement OOP
commitResults.messageBody:
- Create Ui and Parser classes and combine them with TaskList and Storage to extract out closely related code as classes
- Refactor Duke to implement these classes
- Shift all user interactions, including I/O from the console to the Ui class
- Shift all input parsing to the Parsing class

commitResults.messageBody:
Keywords are compared with descriptions of all tasks, and hence
the keywords are required to be absolutely accurate for successful
finds.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update build.gradle to match new classes
Make DialogBox resizable while preserving content
Allow resizing application window, update GUI
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently,
- Text isn't wrapped in rows and extends on horizontally which
  requires users to scroll through the window to read the entire
  text
- Resizing the window isn't possible at the moment, either, and
  needs to be implemented
- Setting proper indentation depending on the dialog author will
  also enhance the user experience

Let's:
- Enable wrapping of text in Label by setting the "HBox.hgrow"
  property to "ALWAYS"
- Fix resizing issue by setting AnchorPane anchors
- Update indentation of Label text depending on who the dialog is from

Enabling wrapping with a prop is a better choice than wrapping the
Label object in a TextFlow object, preventing any side-effects.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused Ui class and text I/O testing

commitResults.messageBody:
Certain assertions need to hold true for the app processes to
continue reliably. Let's add the following assertions:

- output from commands can never be empty
- itemList can never be uninitialised
- error messages should always start with "Hang on" for clarity
  that they're checked exceptions
- tasks in itemList can never be empty

Code quality can be better improved, there are certain instances
of weak SLAP and code duplication leading to unnecessarily long
methods in the code.

Let's:
- Avoid code duplication in AddItemCommand.java by moving addition
  to itemList and the return statement to the bottom of the method
- Better follow SLAP in FindCommand.java by abstracting out the
  joinInput and joinOutput methods
- Avoid code duplication in Storage.java by implementing a private
  method for task checking
- Better follow SLAP in TaskList.java by implementing a method in
  DukeTask.java to check for description matches

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unnecessary docs, follow reuse policy

commitResults.messageBody:
- Create UpdateDescriptionCommand class for this purpose
- Add relevent exception checking regarding indexes and missing
  descriptions
- Abstract string output for IndexOutOfBoundsException to a
  single static field for better code quality

- Create UpdateTimeCommand class for this purpose
- Add relevent exception checking regarding indexes and missing
  time
- Implement better abstraction across Parser, Deadline, DukeTask,
  Event and TaskList classes

commitResults.messageTitle: Add "help", update identity, check input case
commitResults.messageBody:
Users are not aware of all possible commands they can use. Also,
the identity needs to be revamped from "Apollo" to "Artemis".
Capital letter inputs are unable to be processed too.

Let's:
- Add a "help" command that lists all available commands
- Rebrand from Apollo to Artemis
- Update chat icons to match the astronaut theme
- Add new chat icon for error messages
- Allow any input case to be processed

The list of available commands is huge and takes up a sizeable
amount of space. Let's export this to a new window, and implement
some more minor changes

- Using 'help' now opens up a new window with a list of available
  commands
- Added new icons for success and error messages
- Update user icons
- Update user guide
- Catch marked tasks being marked and vice versa
